data.title: A little disappointed
data.text: Pizza was great. However service was very slow. We ordered Caesar Salads as appetizers but they arrived at the same time as the pizza, which is really odd. The salad had twice as much dressing than it should; but the dressing was very tasty... had they put 50% less sauce, this could have been the best Caesar I had ever had. After finishing our salads, we wanted to start on the pizza but didn't have clean plates. We waited a few minutes for our server to walk buy so that we could ask her for plates for the pizza. She responded by saying that everyone is complaining but she didn't know what to do .... I didn't complain, I was simply asking for two clean plates (versus putting our pizza in plates having lots of sauce residue from our salads). Anyhow when we received our plates and started in on the pizza, we really enjoyed the pizza. If in the area again, we would likely go in for the pizza only .... or takeout

data.title: Not very impressed
data.text:
We had never been to Tony’s, but were in the downtown area recently and thought we’d give it a try.  We ordered 10 chicken wings and a 20” Florentine white pizza for 3 people.  I have enjoyed chicken wings for decades and have ordered them at a lot of restaurants in this area over the years.  I would rank the wings we got here as some of the worst I’ve had.  They were small, too greasy, and had very little flavor.  Certainly, at $10 for 10 little drums or flappers, it was not a good deal.  If I were grading Tony’s on just their wings, I would give it a poor rating.

However, Tony’s is a pizzeria, not a wing restaurant.  The pizza we got was okay, but certainly not the best we’ve had in that coastal area.  And, I thought the price was too high.  The total price for the pizza was $27 ($18 for the base pizza, $4 for one extra topping, and $5 to upgrade to a 20” pizza).  So, overall, I can only give Tony’s an average rating at best.  However, the location is good, being close to the Capitol Theatre and Coachman Park.  Plus, there are a lot of empty store fronts along Cleveland Street near the waterfront (I hope that improves!) and the dining choices are limited when attending an event.  So, we may stop at Tony's again when downtown and get a different pizza; perhaps their pizzas with meat and red sauce are better.

data.title: Just ok
data.text: This restaurant is close to Clearwater Marine Aquarium's "Movie" location, and in fact, was recommended to us by one of the Aquarium's staff members. While the NY style pizza was appreciated and they did a serviceable job with it, service was not good. It took forever to have our food delivered, and we had to flag our server for EVERYTHING. Making it worse, it must be a local spot for Texas Longhorns fans - and a small table of fans was screaming at the top its lungs with every play. Would it have been too much to ask them to quiet down as not everyone there was a Longhorns fan?

data.title: Catering to a Captive Audience
data.text: Wanted sandwiches & drinks prior to a 7:30 pm concert across the street at the Capitol Theatre, so we ducked into Tony's around 6:15 on a Wednesday evening. After being seated we were surprised to find out only entrees were served in the dining area, a lot more to eat and a lot more expensive than we were prepared for. Since we didn't have time to go elsewhere, we ended up with grilled chicken caesar salads. The salads were tasty & I requested bread or rolls, which our server said was no problem. Never saw her or any bread again, until she finally showed up with our check. Appears to me that they've figured out how to get the "show crowd" to spend as much money as possible in a short time for average food & sub-par service. We'll go back to the Capitol Theatre, but not to this restaurant !

data.title: Service is Key
data.text: This has always been one of my favorite lunch spots because the pizza is good and the salads are fresh. The only issue I have ever had is service. This restaurant is in a very busy location on main street in downtown Clearwater so you think they would be staffed accordingly, but sadly no. I was hopeful after the remodel we would see more servers but it has gone from bad to worse. While I don't mind the hipster update to the furnishings, the music is horrible-like a 90's alternative group begging for a little attention. I went on a Friday at 12:30.  Packed restaurant. 2 servers. That's it. 1 to cover the bar & half the tables & the other to cover the counter & rest of the tables, inside & out. Seriously? I ordered a slice of pizza & it came out cold. Sent it back. Got a new piece, same issue. The server literally threw the check down (was on a plastic tray) because other tables were needing to go as well. Save your money & the aggravation & eat elsewhere until they hire more trained servers who know how to communicate w/the customers.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: AC was broken. Mid 80s and humid. Out of the wine we ordered. Won't be back. Didn't have time to go anywhere else before the show at Capital Theatre. Food was good but the experience was terrible

data.title: Pizza night
data.text: Great thin crust pizza. Wife ate the chicken parm and it was delicious. Place was clean with nice decor and had a full bar. Servers and host were friendly and courteous. Plenty of parking available as well.

data.title: I love Tonys!
data.text:
Great place for lunch break or to go when you are heading downtown for a show at the Capitol Theatre.
Grilled chicken ceasar salad is my favorite. Next to the pizza of course.

data.title: Not bad
data.text: The female server was witty and pretty. However the food was more bar fare as opposed to Italian cuisine.

data.title: unimpressed
data.text: Went for dinner. This restaurant is good for children and families. Appears to be clean. Prices are fair. Ordered a large pizza with pepperoni and mushrooms. It was BLAND and on the soggy side. Was hoping for a nice cold beer with a chilled glass but instead I got the excuse that something in the back wasn't working properly so no chilled glass and the beer wasn't very cold. Service started out well, but after we paid we noticed that we did not receive the correct change. We were 91 cents short. Not a big deal but when we brought it to the server's attention she said she doesn't carry change, she just "rounds up the bill"  and that "this is the norm in the food industry". Being in the food industry most of my life I DISAGREE. It is NEVER appropriate to do that to a customer. Actually it's rude and deceiving. If you want to "round up" an invoice then do it in the customer's favor. I usually over tip as I know how hard servers work for tips but this type of poor attitude is not acceptable.

data.title: A delicious quick lunch
data.text: We needed a quick lunch before catching our boat shuttle back to the Clearwater Aquarium.  Our  9 yr old picky eater only wanted chicken nuggets or pizza.  When we saw Tony's, we went in and asked how quickly we could get pizza.  We were advised 15 min. at the most.  Great!  We were given menus and beverages.  When we saw pizza by the slice, we were sold, as our picky eater only eats cheese pizza.  So, 2 cheese slices and 1 all-meat slice.  They came out very quickly and were they delicious!  The 9 yr old ate hers down to the edges of the crust and she seldom eats that much.  We were very happy with both our meals and our service.

data.title: That's Amore !!
data.text:
Amore means LOVE, and we LOVE eating at Tony's. I feel like I'm at a family restaurant in Queens, NY!  We especially love the Eggplant Rollatini. I'm a NY Italian, and I don't waste my time on mediocre Italian food. It's either GREAT, or I won't bother!
Tony's food is EXCELLENT! The servings are generous and the prices very reasonable.
We have found the servers to be very attentive and caring, as well!

data.title: Excellent Little Italian Restaurant
data.text: My husband and I stop here anytime we are in the area around dinner time. It is one of our favorite places to eat! We are used to New York Italian and this come very close! The service is good...and we like the atmosphere! Booths and tables to choose from and large enough to accommodate a crowd. There is also outdoor seating if you prefer.

data.title: Great New York style pies!
data.text: We saw Tony!  He was on his way out for the night, but we still saw him!  We were the last table for the night, but the bartender did a great job of not rushing us out the door!  We created our own pizza and it was amazing!  It maybe could have used a dash of seasoning, but I couldn't tell you what that might be; it just seemed to be missing something?  Don't let that detour you though!  We will be back!

data.title: Perfect NY Pizza
data.text: This is closest you will get to authentic NY cheese pizza in Pinellas county. Tony is a very community conscious business owner and he runs a great restaurant. Nice staff. Always fresh food. Clean. Been eating here for years...have tried almost everything on the menu. Never disappointed with flavor or quantity.

data.title: Unprepared for customers on night of show at Capitol
data.text:
Food output was ridiculously slow the night of a show across the street. Staffing should be appropriate to number of clients and raised on nights there is an event.

Pizza was mediocre. Sangria was not worth the money so avoid this choice.

data.title: BY ACCIDENT
data.text: Met some friends here before a concert at the Capitol..This place is quite large and so is the menu..The lighting was a bit bright for a restaurant..The food was very good and our server Simon did a great job..We'll be back..

data.title: Good little pizza restaurant
data.text: This is a pub style restaurant that has a number of selections for pizza.  The pizza is good and quantity and quality is decent. It did take a while to get the pizzas but worth the wait.  Served with forks and knives and you do need them as well as napkins.  These are 16" size tossed dough pizzas.

data.title: Nice pie
data.text: I stopped here for dinner prior to a show at the Capitol Theater. This was a nice quality pie. Thin and crispy like a north easterner wants it.. Crust was light and tasty, sauce was nice and sweet enough for my taste and the cheese was excellent. Pepperoni was just spicy enough to add good flavor without overpowering the taste of the pie. I will be back on my next stop at the Capitol.

data.title: Wow worth the drive
data.text: Pizza was amazing, vodka pasta was great chicken parm was great cozy and will go again. Was not expensive and this is the kind of place you would expect to be in NY/NJ and be expensive

user_location.name: Berkeley Heights, New Jersey, United States
